intro: Psychotria hypochlorina, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary or the ghost plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and striking white or pale blue flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous minute seeds. Psychotria hypochlorina is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
